page.title: 15Rendcomb College Land
page.content: Its education includes 250 pupils & 25 staff in an area of 120 acres,most of it used for recreation.The College has a few tennis courts & some playing fields.A golf course & a large playing field is being built,the latter dedicated to the founder's widow.The ecology of part of their area is unused & left so that trees can grow.This is called the "wilderness" & a lot of wildlife is to be found there including pheasants.This wood is composed mainly of oak & sycamore.A section of the land has houses built on it.The boundaries of the land are made of dry Cotswold stone walls
